findings.title: Withdrawing from Yearn to DInterest in a single step can save gas
findings.description: Optimizing `YVaultMarket.withdraw` by withdrawing funds from `YVaultMarket` and transferring the balance to `msg.sender` in a single step can save gas.

findings.title: Linearization of exponential compounding could lead to insolvency
findings.description: In money markets such as Aave and Compound, liquidity is expected to compound exponentially. However, when computing the money market rate per second, the 88mph protocol assumes that the rate will compound linearly.

findings.title: Users are not informed of the pitfalls of using Yearn vaults
findings.description: Yearn is inherently more risky than other money markets and requires caution on the user's side. The 88mph protocol uses a uniform abstraction over Yearn, Aave, Compound, and other money markets. Some of Yearn's implementation details can leak through this abstraction.
